author: Bourse Direct
title: Nvidia tacle l'administration Biden
text:
Nvidia tacle l'administration Biden
Des mesures absurdes ?
Nvidia a critiqué les nouvelles restrictions à l'exportation de puces qui devraient être annoncées prochainement par l'administration Biden, estimant que la Maison Blanche tente ainsi de saper la nouvelle administration Trump en imposant des règles de dernière minute. Selon Bloomberg, les nouvelles règles qui pourraient être annoncées ce jour créeraient trois niveaux de limitations concernant les puces. Un groupe d'alliés des États-Unis bénéficierait d'un accès total aux semi-conducteurs américains, mais la plupart des pays seraient confrontés à de nouvelles limites, notamment sur la puissance de calcul totale pouvant être attribuée à un pays. Bloomberg note que si cette politique était annoncée, il faudrait attendre moins de deux semaines avant que Donald Trump ne prête serment en tant que successeur de Joe Biden. "Nous encourageons le président Biden à ne pas devancer le nouveau président Trump en adoptant une politique qui ne fera que nuire à l'économie américaine, faire reculer l'Amérique et faire le jeu des adversaires américains", a déclaré Ned Finkle, vice-président de Nvidia pour les affaires gouvernementales, cité par Bloomberg.
Le DG de Nvidia, Jensen Huang, avait déclaré plus tôt cette semaine qu'il était prêt à rencontrer Trump et à proposer son aide. "Je serais ravi d'aller le voir et de le féliciter, et de faire tout ce que nous pouvons pour que cette administration réussisse", avait affirmé Huang dans une interview à Bloomberg Television. S'exprimant lors du CES de Las Vegas cette semaine, Huang avait aussi indiqué qu'il s'attendait à ce que Trump introduise moins de réglementation. "Je pense que c'est une bonne chose", avait glissé le fondateur de Nvidia, selon lequel "en tant qu'industrie, nous voulons aller vite".
Les changements imminents rapportés par Bloomberg limiteraient donc la vente de puces d'intelligence artificielle américaines à la fois par pays et par entreprise, ce qui limiterait plus étroitement les exportations vers la plupart des pays du monde - tout cela dans le cadre d'un effort américain de longue date visant à garder les dernières technologies à l'écart de la Chine et de la Russie. "La politique extrême de plafonnement par pays affecterait les ordinateurs grand public dans les pays du monde entier, ne faisant rien pour promouvoir la sécurité nationale mais poussant plutôt le monde vers des technologies alternatives", a déclaré Ned Finkle. "Cela n'a aucun sens pour la Maison Blanche de Biden de contrôler les ordinateurs et la technologie des centres de données quotidiens qui sont déjà présents dans les PC de jeu dans le monde entier", a résumé Finkle.
Les informations et conseils rédigés par la rédaction de Boursier.com sont réalisés à partir des meilleures sources, même si la société Boursier.com ne peut en garantir l'exhaustivité ni la fiabilité. Ces contenus n'ont aucune valeur contractuelle et ne constituent en aucun cas une offre de vente ou une sollicitation d'achat de valeurs mobilières ou d'instruments financiers. La responsabilité de la société Boursier.com et/ou de ses dirigeants et salariés ne saurait être engagée en cas d'erreur, d'omission ou d'investissement inopportun.

author: NTM / EFE
title: Abás pide el fin del "río de sangre" del pueblo palestino en su mensaje de Navidad
text:
El presidente palestino, Mahmud Abás, pidió hoy el fin del "rio de sangre" y de los "inmensos sacrificios" del pueblo palestino en un mensaje de felicitación de Navidad, celebración que cobra especial relevancia en Belén, donde la tradición cristiana ubica el nacimiento de Jesús.
"El río de sangre, los inmensos sacrificios, las penurias y la heroica resiliencia de nuestro pueblo en su tierra son el camino hacia la libertad y la dignidad", afirmó el presidente de la Autoridad Palestina, que gobierna zonas reducidas de Cisjordania ocupada.
Cada 24 de diciembre, Belén -centro de la comunidad cristiana palestina- celebra un tradicional desfile con bandas de música, previo a la llegada del Patriarca Latino de Jerusalén a pie para oficiar una misa en la Iglesia de Santa Catalina, la parte católica basílica de la Natividad.
Pero este año, el patriarca Pierbattista Pizzaballa -el enviado religioso del Vaticano a Tierra Santa- llegará a Belén en una procesión solemne, sin música ni actos festivos, de luto por el alto número de muertos palestinos en la guerra en la Franja de Gaza, que superan los 20.200 mientras prosigue la ofensiva israelí.
Cisjordania ocupada también ha vivido su año más mortífero desde 2002, el pico de violencia de la Segunda Intifada, con unos 510 muertos, más de la mitad desde el 7 de octubre, cuando comenzó la guerra en el enclave.
Abás expresó hoy, día de Nohebuena, su esperanza de que esta Navidad marque el cese de la guerra israelí contra el pueblo palestino en Gaza y el resto de territorios palestinos ocupados, deseando "prosperidad y estabilidad para el pueblo palestino y todas las naciones".
"El sol de la libertad y [nuestro] Estado independiente con Jerusalén como capital está inevitablemente surgiendo, casi a nuestro alcance", afirmó el presidente en su discurso de Navidad.
"El pueblo palestino está decidido a continuar su lucha para lograr sus derechos legítimos, el principal de los cuales es el derecho a un Estado independiente y plenamente soberano, donde puedan vivir con dignidad en su patria", agregó.
El presidente palestino también rindió homenaje a los miles de "mártires de Palestina", deseó una pronta recuperación para los heridos, libertad para los prisioneros y oró por la preservación del pueblo palestino en Gaza, Cisjordania, Jerusalén y la diáspora.

author: , Courier News
title: Newborn leap baby delivered at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital
text: Charles "Chaz" Gildersleeve Jr., who was born Thursday, Feb. 29 at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital's Maternity Unit in New Brunswick, is among a special group of children with leap day birthdays. Chaz entered the world at 7:06 a.m. weighing 9 pounds, 10 ounces, according to the hospital. The odds of having a leap day birthday are estimated at about one in 1,500, according to the hospital. Only about 200,000 people are born on Feb. 29 in America, and now Chaz is one of them. The leap year and extra day was instituted officially in 1582 with the Gregorian calendar (though it dates back to ancient Egyptian times) due to the amount of time it takes the earth to go around the sun, and as a measure to help keep the seasons occurring at the same time every year. Yet to be decided for Chaz is the dilemma parents of babies born on Feb. 29 all face, whether to celebrate their child's birthday once every four years, or twice every year on Feb. 28 and March 1. “He took his time with his arrival so we are just happy that he is here and want to celebrate,” said his mother, Christine Gildersleeve. RWJUH delivers 2,500 babies annually. Email: srussell@gannettnj.com Suzanne Russell is a breaking news reporter for MyCentralJersey.com covering crime, courts and other mayhem. To get unlimited access, please subscribe or activate your digital account today.

author: globo.com
title: CEO do Atlético-GO detona árbitro do empate por 1 a 1 contra o Bahia: "Tinha que ser banido do futebol" | atlético-go | ge
text:
Irritado com o resultado da partida, Adson Batista, CEO do Atlético-GO, disparou contra o árbitro Luciano da Silva Miranda, do Ceará. O dirigente rubro-negro saiu na bronca após o empate por 1 a 1 contra o Bahia , na noite de quarta-feira, e disse que o juiz "não tem condição de apitar jogo do nível de Série A. Nem de Série B" ( veja no vídeo abaixo ).
O Dragão vencia o jogo por 1 a 0 e levou gol de empate aos 53 minutos do segundo tempo. Adson, no entanto, criticou não só um lance específico, mas a atuação do árbitro durante toda a partida. Segundo ele, Luciano da Silva Miranda deveria ser "banido do futebol".
- Se eu falar tudo que eu quero, tudo que eu penso dessa esculhambação, eu vou ser banido do futebol. Esse árbitro não tem capacidade de apitar jogo algum. Ele é que tinha que ser banido do futebol. É um árbitro que passa intranquilidade, inseguro e sem o mínimo de condição de apitar um jogo do nível de Série A. Nem de Série B. Vamos respeitar as outras séries. É um cara despreparado, que inverte faltas e não tem o timing de entender o jogo - afirmou Adson após a partida no Accioly.
+ Time e comissão técnica do Dragão partem para cima do juiz; vídeo
1 de 1 Adson Batista, diridente do Dragão — Foto: Ingryd Oliveira/ACG Adson Batista, diridente do Dragão — Foto: Ingryd Oliveira/ACG
O dirigente do Atlético-GO detonou também o Árbitro de Vídeo (VAR). Sem citar um lance específico, Adson afirmou que o VAR atua "de acordo com a camisa", no sentindo de favorecer clubes maiores do futebol brasileiro. O CEO acabou alfinetando até John Textor, dono do Botafogo, que vem falando de supostas manipulações de resultado no futebol do Brasil, mas sem apresentar quaisquer provas a respeito das acusações.
- O VAR se posiciona de acordo com a camisa, com o que dá menos desgaste na mídia e no Brasil. Isso é minha opinião. Estou falando que alguém é malandro, desonesto? Não. São critérios (diferentes) que eles adotam para Palmeiras, Flamengo, São Paulo, Botafogo, que esculhambou com o futebol brasileiro e não apresentou nada.
O Atlético-GO é lanterna da Série A, com apenas 12 pontos, e não vence há 10 jogos. O Dragão volta a campo no domingo contra o Flamengo.

author: Tom Santaniello
title: Nonprofit meets with families of fallen first responders | wfmynews2.com
text: The Carolina Brotherhood met with the families of Greensboro Police Sergeant Dale Nix and Lexington Fire Captain Ronnie Metcalf.

author: archyworldyscom
title: The conversation with the German Scholz was partially disappointing – Stubb: “I find it a shame” –
text:
President Alexander Stubb views North Korea ‘s alleged involvement in Russian military operations in Ukraine as Russia ‘s weakness.
President of the Republic Alexander Stubb sees claims that North Korean troops are joining the war in Ukraine as a sign of Russia’s desperation.
Stubb met the German chancellor on Tuesday Olaf Scholzin in Berlin.
In the press conference organized at the end of the state visit, Stubb explained the topics of the discussion to the Finnish press. The topics covered were, among other things, strengthening cooperation between the countries and future support for Ukraine.
Additionally, Stubb provided his own assessment of military intelligence claims that North Korea sent its soldiers to the front to support Russia.
In the press conference Stubb calmed fears of North Korea’s possible entry into the war in Ukraine. Escalation and World War III are not a likely scenario for Stubbs.
– I see it more as a weakness of Russia. If North Korea and Iran are allies, things will not go very well, Stubb repeated his earlier statement to Reuters.
Frustration The main focus of the discussions was the war in Ukraine and the means by which Finland and Germany can continue to support the country.
Germany’s reluctance to deliver weapons has been a recurring concern. Stubb said he still has faith in Germany, although he currently has no desire to provide Ukraine with the long-range missiles it so desperately needs.
– Apparently the Taurus missiles will not be removed in the near future to help Ukraine, which I find unpleasant, Stubb described the discussion with Scholz on the topic.
The press asked President Stubb if he had received any messages from Germany to take to Peking. Stubb will pay a state visit to China next week.
– When making a state visit to China, you can always act as a messenger. This is pretty basic diplomacy.
“The US will not withdraw from NATO” Stubb also commented on the American presidential elections at a press conference. The topic interests the European NATO countries, with this choice Donald Trump’s AND Horrible Harris there are sometimes fears that the superpower’s commitment to NATO could have consequences.
– Right now everyone is holding their breath and waiting for the election results. No one dares to say in which direction the situation will go, Stubb has given his opinion on the elections.
Stubb said he is confident that the United States will not abandon NATO, regardless of which of the candidates is elected president.
Stubb reminds us that regardless of who is elected, they all have one thing in common: the desire to maintain the United States as a great power and challenge China.
– If they want to succeed, they need allies. I don’t believe it for a second when it comes to the US withdrawal from NATO, Stubb said.
Stubb also met with the former chancellor on Tuesday Angela Merkel . With him we discussed the same topics discussed with Scholzink, i.e. Russia, the Middle East and NATO.
No previous updates
Stubb and Scholz made short statements to the media as early as 5 pm Finnish time before heading to the personal meeting.
In the briefing, Chancellor Scholz said that Germany and Finland were deepening their cooperation at both EU and NATO levels.
President Alexander Stubb and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz gave short speeches at 5pm. Rosa Bröijer
Scholz reminds that Germany and Finland are staunch supporters of Ukraine in the war against Russia. According to the Chancellor, this will continue to be the case.
– Putin cannot hope that we will abandon Ukraine, Scholz said.
President Stubb believes that the November US presidential election is important for the future of the world.
President Stubb believes that the crisis in the Middle East and the peace negotiations over the war in Ukraine will continue as long as the great power has elected a president.
– I believe that the window of opportunity will open after the US elections, said President Stubb.
The official press conference was held at 7.00 pm.
Furthermore, Stubb’s program includes a bilateral meeting with the president of Iceland Halla Tómasdóttirin with.
Stubb is his companion By Suzanne Innes-Stubb with a two-day visit to Berlin.
In the press conference Alexander Stubb told, among other things, what he talked about with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. Rosa Bröijer
President Stubb paid a state visit to Germany. Rosa Bröijer
Alexander Stubb and Olaf Scholz also met in May. ZumaWire/MVPHOTOS
